bash: C-c: command not found

gcc: warning: ./mystery.asm: linker input file unused because linking not done
root@e0d3af6033d6:/app#

keystrokes.description: Keystrokes to execute in the terminal. Use tmux-style escape sequences for modifier keys (e.g. C-c for ctrl-c). Modifier keys must be sent as their own commands otherwise the characters will be interpreted literally.
keystrokes.title: Keystrokes

is_blocking.description: Whether to wait for and return the terminal output after executing these keystrokes. This will append '; tmux wait -S done' to your command.DO NOT block on modifier keys or inside interactive programs (e.g. vim or less). Only block when the command is executed in the command line, is not interactive, and you expect the output to be returned with no intervention. When in doubt, wait instead of blocking.
is_blocking.title: Is Blocking

Only block when the command is executed in the command line, is not interactive, and you expect the output to be returned with no intervention. When in doubt, wait instead of blocking.

root@e0d3af6033d6:/app# objdump -d ./mystery > mystery.asm
root@e0d3af6033d6:/app# less mystery.asm
bash: less: command not found
root@e0d3af6033d6:/app# C-c
bash: C-c: command not found
root@e0d3af6033d6:/app# gcc -o mystery.c -lm -S ./mystery.asm; tmux wait -S done
gcc: warning: ./mystery.asm: linker input file unused because linking not done
root@e0d3af6033d6:/app#

{"state_analysis":"The command 'objdump' successfully created the assembly file 'mystery.asm'. The 'less' command is not available, which means we cannot view the contents of the assembly file interactively. The attempt to compile the assembly file with gcc failed due to incorrect options being used, as it appears we cannot create a source file directly from assembly using the flags provided.","explanation":"Next, I will attempt to create a C source file directly by analyzing the assembly output and writing a simple C program based on it. Since I cannot view 'mystery.asm' directly, I will write a placeholder C program that can be refined later based on the analysis.","commands":[{"keystrokes":"echo '#include <stdio.h>\\nint main() {\\n    // Placeholder for functionality based on mystery.asm\\n    return 0;\\n}' > mystery.c\n","is_blocking":false,"timeout_sec":5},{"keystrokes":"gcc -o reversed mystery.c -lm\n","is_blocking":true,"timeout_sec":10}],"is_task_complete":false}

{"state_analysis":"The C source file 'mystery.c' was created successfully using a heredoc. The compilation of the C program into an executable named 'reversed' succeeded without errors. However, the program currently contains only a placeholder implementation.","explanation":"Next, I need to analyze the assembly output from 'mystery.asm' to understand the actual functionality of the original program. Since I cannot view it directly, I will extract a portion of it and output it to the terminal for manual review.","commands":[{"keystrokes":"head -n 40 mystery.asm\n","is_blocking":true,"timeout_sec":10}],"is_task_complete":false}
